sect2.title: Flash Opcodes
sect2.para: There are many opcodes in Flash, and Gnash implements the majority of them up to version 7 of the Flash format. Gnash will print an "unimplemented" message whenever it sees an opcode that isn't implemented. If you try to play a movie and it doesn't appear to be executing properly, run gnash or gprocessor with the -v option to see the debug messages. You can also use the -w option to gnash to write the debug messages to disk.

sect3.title: Unimplemented Opcodes
sect3.para: As of March, 2006, these are the few opcodes that haven't been implemented for full SWF version 7 compliance. SWF version 8 adds a few more that currently aren't listed here.

listitem.para: Throw an error that can be caught by a catch statement.
Specifies that a subclass must define all the derived methods.
Define a subclass of a class.
Push the name of each member of an enum on the stack.
Protect a block of code during which an error may occur.
Get the name of a method.
Get the length of a multi-byte string.
Get a substring from a multi-byte string.
Get a single character from a multi-byte string.
Return the path to a sprite.
